Question
========
A researcher surveying pileated woodpeckers visits the same forest twice. Let A = “woodpecker detected on visit 2” and B = “woodpecker detected on visit 1.” Which statement best describes P(A | B)?

Answerlist
----------
* Probability of B given A
* Probability of A given B
* Probability that both occur
* Probability that neither occurs

Solution
========
P(A | B) is the probability of **A given B** occurred.
